An open letter to the mayor of NYC
 Dear Mayor Adams,
My name is , a resident of  and I am writing this letter to raise concern about the high number of car crashes in New York City that have resulted in injuries or deaths. Based on 2020 data gathered from NYC Open Data, it‚Äôs clear that this is a pressing issue that needs immediate attention. The following are some startling statistics from the data:
33,442 crashes in 2020 that resulted in either injury or death. Of these, - 9,137 crashes were attributed to driver inattention/distraction - 1,414 crashes were attributed to unsafe speed - 532 crashes were attributed to alcohol involvement

To address this, I urge the city to consider stricter traffic enforcement, improved road infrastructure, and/or public awareness campaigns.
Vision Zero, the city‚Äôs current citywide initiative to eliminate death and serious injuries from traffic incidents, isn‚Äôt enough.
Thank you for your attention to this important matter.
Sincerely,
